HMGB1-A-BOX is a low-molecular-weight protein of 10 kDa. SUMO proteases have been observed to successfully cleave a wide range of sizes (6–110 kDa) of partner proteins fused to SUMO. the yields of the HMGB1-A-BOX fusion protein obtained with a glutathione S-transferase (GST) tag were acceptable, although removal of the GST tag affected the activity of the target protein. SUMO fusion was reported to enhance protein expression, solubility and purification in prokaryotes (22) this fusion technology is able to improve the expression of the recombinant proteins by protecting them from degradation. recombinant HMGB1-A-BOX protein is considered to compete with HMGB1 for receptor activation. truncation of HMGB1 into individual structural domains revealed that HMGB1-A-box specifically antagonizes the activity of HMGB1 and rescues mice from lethal sepsis (9).
